intro: Henckelia nervosa, commonly known as the veined henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves with prominent venation. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Henckelia nervosa is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks.
